channel.title: Cornell Social Media Lab / @CUSocialMedia
channel.description: Twitter feed for: @CUSocialMedia. Generated by nitter.poast.org

item.title:
RT by @CUSocialMedia: Please help spread the words 📣
I’m recruiting a full-time creative technologist/researcher to join our lab and together craft novel interactions and experiences with AI-generated texts. HCI/NLP/IXD background is a plus. Pre- or postdoc applicants welcome.
item.dc:creator: @fabulousQian
item.description:
Please help spread the words 📣

I’m recruiting a full-time creative technologist/researcher to join our lab and together craft novel interactions and experiences with AI-generated texts. HCI/NLP/IXD background is a plus. Pre- or postdoc applicants welcome.

item.title: 🎉 Congratulations to SML Ph.D. student @bae_inhwan on receiving the 2024-25 PCCW Frank H.T. Rhodes Mission Grant! 🌟 Her project focuses on combating online toxicity against women and nonbinary persons with tailored persuasion messages using large language models.
item.dc:creator: @CUSocialMedia
item.description: 🎉 Congratulations to SML Ph.D. student @bae_inhwan on receiving the 2024-25 PCCW Frank H.T. Rhodes Mission Grant! 🌟 Her project focuses on combating online toxicity against women and nonbinary persons with tailored persuasion messages using large language models.

item.title: SML members @bae_inhwan @isabellemcdaph @haesooheatherk and Julia Sebastien had a lovely meeting with the students @btf_bluetree about youth social media safety! It was great to chat, @ParkChanJun_ , thank you for inviting us! #bluetreefoundation
item.dc:creator: @CUSocialMedia
item.description: SML members @bae_inhwan @isabellemcdaph @haesooheatherk and Julia Sebastien had a lovely meeting with the students @btf_bluetree about youth social media safety! It was great to chat, @ParkChanJun_ , thank you for inviting us! #bluetreefoundation

item.title: We are excited to welcome Han Li, @HanLi_1231 to SML! Han joined our collaborative project on "Deterring Objectionable Behaviors Online," https://socialsciences.cornell.edu/deterring-objectionable-behavior-online She comes to us after her postdoc at the NUS where she worked with Dr. Renwen Zhang (@renwenzhang). Welcome, Han!
item.dc:creator: @CUSocialMedia
item.description: We are excited to welcome Han Li, @HanLi_1231 to SML! Han joined our collaborative project on "Deterring Objectionable Behaviors Online," socialsciences.cornell.edu/d… She comes to us after her postdoc at the NUS where she worked with Dr. Renwen Zhang (@renwenzhang). Welcome, Han!

item.title: Our Ph.D. student @haesooheatherk represented the SML at the UN’s 63rd Session of the Commission for Social Development! Invited by @btf_bluetree, she spoke on what academic research can do to build a safer online future. #BTF https://webtv.un.org/en/asset/k1t/k1tbxblcyi
item.dc:creator: @CUSocialMedia

item.title: RT by @CUSocialMedia: Curious about the most effective strategy for objecting to online offenses and winning support from onlookers? #HateSpeech #misinformation . Check out our latest paper in the Journal of Computer-Mediated Communication @ica_jcmc : https://doi.org/10.1093/jcmc/zmad046. More in the thread!
item.dc:creator: @Pengfei_Zhao_
item.description: Curious about the most effective strategy for objecting to online offenses and winning support from onlookers? #HateSpeech #misinformation . Check out our latest paper in the Journal of Computer-Mediated Communication @ica_jcmc : doi.org/10.1093/jcmc/zmad046. More in the thread!

item.title: RT by @CUSocialMedia: Tomorrow (Oct. 5)! Dr. Fei-Fei Li (@Stanford) gives the @CornellCCSS Annual Lecture, discussing "AI with a human perspective." Co-sponsored by @CornellCIS and @CornellDataSciC. Open to the #Cornell and #Ithaca communities. Details: https://socialsciences.cornell.edu/events/annual-lecture-series
item.dc:creator: @CornellCCSS

item.title: RT by @CUSocialMedia: Heads-up: JARMAC invites proposals from the research community for a target article on the impact of artificial intelligence (AI) on cognition in applied settings. More information will follow. @APA_Journals >@OfficialSARMAC #AI https://www.apa.org/pubs/journals/mac

item.title: RT by @CUSocialMedia: Social #medialiteracy has been proposed as a way to mitigate risks and maximize the benefits of social media use. Thus, there is a need to develop validated measures. A. Purington Drake, @MasurPhil, @nataliebazarova et al. developed a 90-item social #medialiteracy inventory.
item.dc:creator: @JOCAM_online
item.description:
Social #medialiteracy has been proposed as a way to mitigate risks and maximize the benefits of social media use. Thus, there is a need to develop validated measures.
A. Purington Drake, @MasurPhil, @nataliebazarova et al. developed a 90-item social #medialiteracy inventory.

item.title: RT by @CUSocialMedia: I am honored to contribute to this insightful handbook! In the chapter on Individualistic Privacy Theories, @nataliebazarova and I discuss the assumptions, theoretical framework, and emergent directions of online privacy research driven by the individualistic perspective.
item.dc:creator: @Pengfei_Zhao_
item.description: I am honored to contribute to this insightful handbook! In the chapter on Individualistic Privacy Theories, @nataliebazarova and I discuss the assumptions, theoretical framework, and emergent directions of online privacy research driven by the individualistic perspective.

item.title: Our recent study on digital safety was featured in the Cornell Chronicle!
item.dc:creator: @CUSocialMedia
item.description:
Our recent study on digital safety was featured in the Cornell Chronicle!

nitter.poast.org/CornellNews/status/1648375122833686532#m

item.title: R to @CUSocialMedia: 📰: This study aimed to understand young people’s experiences with 2 publicly available digital resources for self-injury—a peer support app and web-based factsheets—and to disentangle potential explanatory mechanisms associated with perceived benefits and harms.
item.dc:creator: @CUSocialMedia
item.description: 📰: This study aimed to understand young people’s experiences with 2 publicly available digital resources for self-injury—a peer support app and web-based factsheets—and to disentangle potential explanatory mechanisms associated with perceived benefits and harms.
